entities.description: "The Tversky index is a mathematical measure used to evaluate the performance of classification models, particularly in imbalanced datasets."
"Dice loss is a loss function used in machine learning, particularly for imbalanced datasets, and is a soft version of the F1 score."
"Focal loss is a loss function introduced by Lin et al. (2017) to address class imbalance by focusing on hard examples during training."
"Lin et al. are researchers who introduced focal loss, a technique to address class imbalance in machine learning."
"Kahn and Marshall are researchers known for their work on importance sampling, a technique to weight training examples."
"Kumar et al. are researchers who proposed self-paced learning, a method to dynamically control example weights during training."
"Girshick et al. are researchers known for their work on object detection and hard negative mining."
"Sudre et al. are researchers who proposed Generalized Dice Loss for addressing class imbalance in image segmentation."
"Section 2 discusses related work, including data resampling techniques and the data imbalance issue in computer vision."
"Section 3 describes different proposed losses, including dice loss and Tversky index, for addressing data imbalance."
"CE loss (Cross-Entropy loss) is a standard loss function used in classification tasks."
"The F1 score is a metric that balances precision and recall, often used to evaluate classification models."
"AdaBoost is a boosting algorithm that focuses on harder examples to improve classifier performance."
"Hard example mining is a technique to downsample majority classes while emphasizing difficult examples."
"Oversampling is a data resampling technique used to balance class distributions."
"Self-paced learning dynamically adjusts example weights during training, focusing on easier examples first."
"Generalized Dice Loss is a variant of dice loss used for class rebalancing in segmentation tasks."
"Binary classification is a machine learning task where instances are classified into one of two classes."
"Multi-class classification extends binary classification to handle more than two classes."
"Object detection is a computer vision task that involves identifying and localizing objects in images."
"Image segmentation is the process of partitioning an image into multiple segments for analysis."
"Kanduri et al. are researchers associated with AdaBoost, a boosting algorithm for classification."
"Malisiewicz et al. are researchers known for their work on hard example mining."
"Chen et al. are researchers who contributed to oversampling techniques and ranking models for imbalance issues."
"Chawla et al. are researchers known for their work on oversampling methods like SMOTE."
"Chang et al. proposed methods to adjust training example weights based on loss."
"Katharopoulos and Fleuret developed techniques for dynamic weight adjustment in training."
"Jiang et al. proposed learning a separate network to predict sample weights."
"Fan et al. contributed to methods for learning sample weights in imbalanced datasets."
"Pang et al. introduced IoU-balanced sampling for object detection tasks."
"Shen et al. investigated Dice-based loss for multi-class organ segmentation."
"Kodym et al. proposed batch soft Dice loss for medical image segmentation."
"Shamir et al. extended the Dice coefficient for probabilistic map comparisons."

relationships.description: "The Tversky index extends dice loss by introducing a weight to trade off precision and recall, providing more flexibility."
"Dice loss and focal loss are both techniques to address class imbalance, with focal loss focusing on hard examples."
"Lin et al. introduced focal loss, a technique to address class imbalance by emphasizing hard examples during training."
"Kahn and Marshall proposed importance sampling, a method to assign weights to training examples."
"Kumar et al. proposed self-paced learning, which dynamically controls example weights during training."
"Girshick et al. are known for their work on hard negative mining, a technique to address class imbalance in object detection."
"Sudre et al. proposed Generalized Dice Loss to address class imbalance in image segmentation tasks."
"Section 2 discusses related work, while Section 3 describes proposed losses, forming a logical progression in the paper."
"CE loss is compared with dice loss, where the latter is proposed as an alternative for imbalanced datasets."
"Dice loss is a soft version of the F1 score, linking these two concepts in classification tasks."
"Both AdaBoost and hard example mining focus on difficult examples to improve model performance."
"Oversampling and self-paced learning are both techniques to address class imbalance but with different approaches."
"Generalized Dice Loss extends dice loss for better handling of class imbalance in segmentation tasks."
"Multi-class classification generalizes binary classification to handle more complex tasks."
"Both object detection and image segmentation are computer vision tasks addressing different aspects of visual data."
"Chen et al. contributed to oversampling techniques for balancing datasets."
"Chawla et al. are known for SMOTE, a popular oversampling method."
"Pang et al. introduced IoU-balanced sampling to address imbalance in object detection."
"Shen et al. applied Dice-based loss to multi-class organ segmentation in medical images."

entities.description: "Cross Entropy Loss is a mathematical function used in machine learning to measure the difference between predicted probabilities and actual labels."
"Dice Coefficient is a statistic used to gauge the similarity of two sets, often applied in machine learning for evaluating model performance."
"Tversky Index is a generalization of the Dice Coefficient, used to measure the similarity between sets with adjustable weights for false positives and false negatives."
"Valverde et al., 2017 is a reference to a research group or paper that discusses the challenges of selecting weighting factors in cross entropy loss."
"Sørensen–Dice coefficient, also known as Dice Coefficient, is a similarity measure between two sets, introduced by Sørensen and Dice."
"Milletari et al., 2016 is a reference to a research group or paper that proposed modifications to the Dice Coefficient for faster convergence in machine learning."
"The standard formulation of cross entropy loss where all training instances contribute equally to the final objective."
"A modified version of CE loss that associates different classes with weighting factors to address class imbalance."
"A method to handle class imbalance by reconstructing datasets through sampling based on human-designed criteria."
"A metric in classification where the model correctly predicts the positive class."
"A metric in classification where the model incorrectly predicts the positive class."
"A metric in classification where the model incorrectly predicts the negative class."
"A classification metric calculated as TP/(TP+FP), measuring the accuracy of positive predictions."
"A classification metric calculated as TP/(TP+FN), measuring the coverage of actual positives."
"The harmonic mean of precision and recall, used to balance both metrics in evaluation."
"A loss function derived from the Dice Coefficient, modified for faster convergence in machine learning."

relationships.description: "Valverde et al., 2017 discusses the challenges and empirical issues associated with using Cross Entropy Loss, particularly in selecting weighting factors."
"The Dice Coefficient is also known as the Sørensen–Dice coefficient, indicating a direct naming relationship."
"Milletari et al., 2016 proposed modifications to the Dice Coefficient to improve its performance in machine learning applications."
"The Tversky Index is a generalization of the Dice Coefficient, indicating a conceptual and mathematical relationship."
"Weighted Cross Entropy Loss is a direct modification of Vanilla CE Loss to handle class imbalance."
"Both are strategies to handle class imbalance, with Data Resampling being an alternative to weighting in CE Loss."
"The Dice Coefficient is mathematically equivalent to the F1 Score when applied to boolean classification metrics."
"Dice Loss is derived from the Dice Coefficient, adapted as an optimization objective in machine learning."
"Precision is calculated using True Positives in its formula, making TP a core component."
"Recall is calculated using True Positives in its formula, making TP a core component."
"F1 Score combines Precision and Recall, showing their joint importance in model evaluation."

entities.description: "Milletari et al. (2016) proposed a modification to the dice loss for faster convergence."
"Lin et al. (2017) proposed the focal loss for object detection in vision, which down-weights the loss assigned to well-classified examples."
"Figure 1 illustrates the derivatives of the four losses, showing how they behave as the probability changes."
"Table 3 presents experimental results for Chinese POS datasets including CTB5, CTB6, and UD1.4."
"Table 4 presents experimental results for English POS datasets."
"Table 2 summarizes all the aforementioned losses discussed in the text."
"Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC) is a metric used to evaluate the similarity between two samples, with modifications proposed for training purposes."
"Dice Loss (DL) is a variant of DSC proposed by Milletari et al. (2016) with a squared denominator for faster convergence."
"Tversky Index (TI) generalizes the dice coefficient by allowing control over the tradeoff between false-negatives and false-positives."
"Tversky Loss (TL) is derived from the Tversky Index, providing flexibility in handling class imbalance during training."
"The F1 score is a harmonic mean of precision and recall, used here as a reference for evaluating classification performance."
"Focal Loss (FL) down-weights well-classified examples to address class imbalance, originally proposed for object detection."
"A proposed adaptive variant of DSC that reduces focus on easy examples by incorporating a decaying factor (1-p)."

relationships.description: "Milletari et al. (2016) proposed a modification to the dice loss for faster convergence."

"TL is the loss function derived from the Tversky Index (TI)."
"DSC is a soft approximation of the F1 score, using continuous probabilities instead of binary thresholds."

entities.description: "Xinhua is a news agency whose articles are included in the Chinese Treebank 5.0 dataset."
"The Information Services Department of HKSAR is an organization whose articles are included in the Chinese Treebank 5.0 dataset."
"Sinorama Magazine is a publication whose articles are included in the Chinese Treebank 5.0 dataset."
"Universal Dependencies is a framework for consistent annotation of grammar across different human languages."
"OntoNotes is a dataset used for Named Entity Recognition, containing texts from various sources."
"MSRA is a Chinese benchmark dataset for Named Entity Recognition, collected from the news domain."
"CoNLL2003 is an English dataset for Named Entity Recognition with 4 entity types."
"CoNLL2012 is a shared task dataset used for English OntoNotes5.0."
"SQuAD is a widely used QA benchmark dataset with multiple versions."
"Quoref is a QA dataset testing coreferential reasoning capability."
"MRPC is a corpus of sentence pairs extracted from online news sources for Paraphrase Identification."
"QQP is a collection of question pairs from Quora for Paraphrase Identification."

"CTB6 is an extension of CTB5, containing more words, characters, and sentences."

"OntoNotes5.0 is an English dataset for Named Entity Recognition with texts from various sources."
